item.title: Easily display Your Script status online
item.dc:creator: @Smartzkid Smartzkid
item.description:
@Smartzkid wrote:

Wow…this is really cool! Im allmost done integrating it into my timer script!

EDIT:
a few questions…
you can update a picture after you’ve created it, right?
If it does…how often does it update? It seems like either my script isn’t working right, or the picture is updating slowly, or not at all…

EDIT:
It seems to be updating right, but only the first two lines…
Is there a character limit for each line?

EDIT:
Nevermind, I got it…it doesn’t take spaces…

item.title: Easily display Your Script status online
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:13, topic:23755”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=36118.msg435239#msg435239 date=1163218881]

[quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=36118.msg435074#msg435074 date=1163216937][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=36118.msg435062#msg435062 date=1163216828]
I don’t get how it sends the data to the page?
[/quote]

GetPage('Http://rscfree.no-ip.org/scarsig/write.php?user=’+username+’&c1=’+Text1+’&c2=’+Text2+’&c3=’+Text3+’&c4=’+Text4);

that right their is the sending of the data to the script :)[/quote]

Oh, I see. It goes to the page, but it’s non existent so it creates it because of the php. Never mind, I’m an idiot. Nice.
[/quote]

not at all you just didnt know :p[/quote]

I was thinking about making an auth server for my new script that might be released, I was thinking of ways to get data/send data on it. I still need to learn some php, but it’s helped me loads.

I was thinking of using something like AddPostVariable() or something similar.

item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“yakman, post:3, topic:23755”]very nice idea, you could add this to a script and keep the URL for yourself, then print things like the time running and ores mined to it, at work or school, just go to the page and see how the scripts doing.

how did you make this, is it PHP or something?

i bet this can be abused and have a keylogger send information to it, so a SCAR keylogger doesnt need to go back to the PC and look at the file or read the debug log[/quote]

yes its 2 different php scripts, 1 that posts the information 1 that reads and displays it[br][size=1]Posted at: November 10, 2006, 04:47:27 PM[/size][hr][quote=“The Un-Named, post:7, topic:23755”]I don’t get how it sends the data to the page?[/quote]

GetPage('Http://rscfree.no-ip.org/scarsig/write.php?user=’+username+’&c1=’+Text1+’&c2=’+Text2+’&c3=’+Text3+’&c4=’+Text4);

that right their is the sending of the data to the script

very nice idea, you could add this to a script and keep the URL for yourself, then print things like the time running and ores mined to it, at work or school, just go to the page and see how the scripts doing.

how did you make this, is it PHP or something?

i bet this can be abused and have a keylogger send information to it, so a SCAR keylogger doesnt need to go back to the PC and look at the file or read the debug log

item.source: Easily display Your Script status online

item.title: Easily display Your Script status online
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

I came up with this idea after turning on a scar script and going to class. I realized i had no way of seeing how my scar script is doing. this very simple procedure is here to fix that problem

Here is the procedure itself:

[scar]Procedure WriteToSig(Text1,Text2,Text3,Text4:String);
Var
username:String;
begin;
username:= ‘test’;
GetPage('Http://rscfree.no-ip.org/scarsig/write.php?user=’+username+’&c1=’+Text1+’&c2=’+Text2+’&c3=’+Text3+’&c4=’+Text4);
writeln(‘Added Log To Your Signature’);
writeln('http://rscfree.no-ip.org/scarsig/index.php?user=’+username);
end;[/scar]

now to use this all you do is change the username to what you want it to be, Then you would just call it whenever you have some text to write, if you do not have 4 lines to write at the time simple just write a space for the other strings.

Here is an example application

[scar]program test;

Procedure WriteToSig(Text1,Text2,Text3,Text4:String);
Var
username:String;
begin;
username:= ‘test’;
GetPage('Http://rscfree.no-ip.org/scarsig/write.php?user=’+username+’&c1=’+Text1+’&c2=’+Text2+’&c3=’+Text3+’&c4=’+Text4);
writeln(‘Added Log To Your Signature’);
writeln('http://rscfree.no-ip.org/scarsig/index.php?user=’+username);
end;
begin
WriteToSig(‘This’,‘Is’,‘Just’,‘ATest’);
end.[/scar]

and here is the outcome:

plans in the future include:
making it more customizable and a larger area to write on.
Password protection so only you can use your file to store data.
Option to not overwrite your log

Read full topic
item.source: Easily display Your Script status online
